alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Cobb (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 8:05PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cherokee and northern Cobb Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 804 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Due West, or 7 miles west of Marietta, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Kennesaw, Woodstock, Acworth, Due West, Kellogg Creek, Sandy Plains, Lost Mountain Park, Oak Grove, Kennesaw State University and Hobgood Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
